--- title: "5.1 — Measuring Market Power — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance=minimal} # Meeting Date *Thursday, April 13, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we begin looking at regulation and antitrust to achieve more competitive markets. We begin with the extremely thorny problems of actually identifying relevant markets and measuring market power. ## Readings - Ch. 8.2.2, 12.1.1, 19 in [Churcha nd Ware, 2000](https://works.bepress.com/jeffrey_church/23/) ### Recommended Readings: - [ Bresnahan, 1982, "The Oligopoly Solution Concept is Identified"](/files/readings/Bresnahan-1982.pdf) - [ U.S. Department of Justice, 2010, "Horizontal Merger Guidelines"](https://www.justice.gov/atr/horizontal-merger-guidelines-08192010) - [ U.S. Department of Justice, 2017, "Herfindal Hirschman Index"](https://www.justice.gov/atr/herfindahl-hirschman-index) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF
